definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: Still, there was no point in denying my almost spooky good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 但是，也毋庸置疑我的好运气的确有点玄乎。

sentences.english: It isn't all mumbo jumbo as some people think.
sentences.chinese: 风水其实没有一些人想象的那样玄乎。

sentences.english: Constructing the feelings sounds beautiful, but too mysterious.
sentences.chinese: 创造感受听起来可能很美妙，但其实却非常玄乎。

sentences.english: As often, however, truth is stranger than fiction.
sentences.chinese: 现实往往往比小说更玄乎。

sentences.english: As far as I can see, their success is a bit iffy .
sentences.chinese: 依我看，他们的成功有点儿玄乎。

definition: mystery within a mystery/the mysteries of the Dao according to Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
superstition/to have a superstitious belief (in sth)
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
